title: Setting One Key to Two Actions in PersistedSettings.json is Allowed or Not ?
body:
Hi,
Setting one key to two actions in **PersistedSettings.json** file is allowed by Riot ?. Like below different cases,

1. R key to Ultimate ability + Champion Mastery.
2. R key to Ultimate ability + Item Active 
    Example : {{champion:107}}  Rengar R can activate Ultimate + Youmuus Item {{item:3142}} 
3. Q key to two abilities, like pressing Q can activate {{champion:107}}  Rengar both Savagery + Battle Roar
4. Q key to Ability + Attack Move Click
5. Left mouse button to Attack Move Click

**From above listed 5 cases which are allowed to use. And which can causes Ban**
_Please answer, I searched Google and unable to find proper Answers._

_Thanks_

replies.body: In general, we don't support modifications of game files.  They usually end up causing you more issues than fixing.  The steps you are trying to do also looks like it's modifying files to do something to automate abilities, do something you normally couldn't, or cause an unfair advantage.  I wouldn't recommend this just to be safe, and also check out our [modifications ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848)guide!
Thanks Got It, I am going to Reset Persistedsetting.json (previously I set Attack Move Click to Left click).

Sounds good!  Resetting your config may be your best bet to make sure your settings are restored to default:

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings.
